oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Review of Bovine Respiratory Disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, Robert A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: preconditioning
weight gain
market-transit shrink
morbidity
mortality
profits
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper dscusses Preconditioning (PC),  which is a management system designed to immunize calves and reduce stressors prior to shipment to a stocker or feeder operation, as well as preweaning (PW), which refers to calves which are weaned and fed as in preconditioning but vaccination and treatments for parasitism are not done.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1983; 102-121
